text: King Edward VII School is a secondary school and language college in Sheffield, England started in 1905. It has a sixth form. This means that students can study there until the age of 18. 50% of sixth form students come from other schools in Sheffield. It is named after King Edward VII of the United Kingdom. In 2013 Ofsted said that the school 'requires improvement'. == References == Category:Schools in England Category:Organisations based in Sheffield Category:1905 establishments in England
title: King Edward VII School
